0: Life expectancy for young HIV-positive adults has risen by 10 years in the United States and Europe thanks to improvements in AIDS drugs known as antiretroviral therapy, researchers said on Thursday. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR This meant many patients can expect to live as long as those without HIV, according to their study published in The Lancet medical journal. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The scientists said the improvements were likely to be largely due to the transition to less toxic medicine combinations, with more drug options for people infected with drug-resistant HIV strains, and better adherence to treatment. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "Our research illustrates a success story of how improved HIV treatments coupled with screening, prevention and treatment of health problems associated with HIV infection can extend the lifespan," said Adam Trickey, who led the research at Britain's University of Bristol. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Antiretroviral therapy, or ART, first became widely used in the mid 1990s. It involves a combination of three or more drugs that block the HIV virus' replication. This helps prevent and repair damage to the immune system caused by the HIV, and also prevents onward spread of the disease.
